member.name: T:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.AccountLogonRights
member.summary: Account rights determine the type of logon that a user account can perform. An administrator assigns account rights to user and group accounts. Each user's account rights include those granted to the user and to the groups to which the user belongs.

member.name: T:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess
member.summary: Access rights for a local security policy.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.ViewLocalInformation
member.summary: This access type is needed to read the target system's miscellaneous security policy information. This includes the default quota, auditing, server state and role information, and trust information. This access type is also needed to enumerate trusted domains, accounts, and privileges.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.ViewAuditInformation
member.summary: This access type is needed to view audit trail or audit requirements information.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.GetPrivateInformation
member.summary: This access type is needed to view sensitive information, such as the names of accounts established for trusted domain relationships.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.TrustAdmin
member.summary: This access type is needed to change the account domain or primary domain information.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.CreateAccount
member.summary: This access type is needed to create a new Account object.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.CreateSecret
member.summary: This access type is needed to create a new Private Data object.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.SetDefaultQuotaLimits
member.summary: Set the default system quotas that are applied to user accounts.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.SetAuditRequirements
member.summary: This access type is needed to update the auditing requirements of the system.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.AuditLogAdmin
member.summary: This access type is needed to change the characteristics of the audit trail such as its maximum size or the retention period for audit records, or to clear the log.

member.name: F:Vanara.Security.AccessControl.SystemSecurity.DesiredAccess.ServerAdmin
member.summary: This access type is needed to modify the server state or role (master/replica) information. It is also needed to change the replica source and account name information.

member.summary: This access type is needed to translate between names and SIDs.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.AccountUtils.CentralAccessPolicy.GetAppliedPolicies(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a seqence of central access policies (CAPs) identifiers (CAPIDs) of all the CAPs applied on a specific computer.
member.param: The name of the specific computer. The name can have the form of "ComputerName" or "\ComputerName". If this parameter is , then the function returns the CAPIDs of the local computer.
member.returns: A sequence of instances that identify the CAPs available on the specified computer.
member.remarks: For specific details about the central access policies, you can query the attributes of the central access policy object in the Active Directory on the specified computer's domain controller. Look for the object whose msAuthz-CentralAccessPolicyID attribute matches one of the returned CAPIDs.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.AccountUtils.CentralAccessPolicy.GetPoliciesForIds(Vanara.PInvoke.PSID[])
member.summary: Returns the Central Access Policies (CAPs) for the specified IDs.
member.param: An array of pointers to CAPIDs that identify the CAPs being queried.
member.returns: A sequence of instances that identify the CAPs available on the specified computer.

member.name: T:Vanara.Security.Principal.WindowsLoggedInIdentity
member.summary: Impersonation of a user. Allows to execute code under another user context. Please note that the account that instantiates this class needs to have the 'Act as part of operating system' privilege set.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.Principal.WindowsLoggedInIdentity.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.AdvApi32.LogonUserType,Vanara.PInvoke.AdvApi32.LogonUserProvider)
member.summary: Provides an identity to a logged into user given the supplied credentials. Please note that the account that instantiates this class needs to have the 'Act as part of operating system' privilege set.
member.param: A string that specifies the name of the user. This is the name of the user account to log on to. If you use the user principal name (UPN) format, User@DNSDomainName, the parameter must be NULL.

A string that specifies the name of the domain or server whose account database contains the account. If this parameter is NULL, the user name must be specified in UPN format. If this parameter is ".", the account is validated by using only the local account database.
A string that specifies the plain-text password for the user account specified by .
Type of the logon. This parameter can usually be left as the default. For more information, lookup more detail for the dwLogonType parameter of the Windows LogonUser function.
The logon provider. This parameter can usually be left as the default. For more information, lookup more detail for the dwLogonProvider parameter of the Windows LogonUser function.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.Principal.WindowsLoggedInIdentity.#ctor(System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity)
member.summary: Starts the impersonation with the given . Please note that the account that instantiates this class needs to have the 'Act as part of operating system' privilege set.

member.summary: Gets the authenticated identity.

member.summary: Gets the type of authentication used.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the user has been authenticated.

member.summary: Gets the name of the current user.

member.name: T:Vanara.Security.UAC
member.summary: Provides information about the state of User Access Control for the system.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.UAC.CanElevate(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Determines whether the provided process can be elevated. Effectively, this checks that UAC is available and that the process is running under an account that belongs to the Administrators group.
member.param: The process. If this value is null, then the current process is used.
member.returns: true if this process can be elevated; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.UAC.IsElevated(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified process is elevated.
member.param: The process. If this value is null, then the current process is used.
member.returns: true if the specified process is elevated; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.UAC.IsEnabled
member.summary: Determines whether UAC is enabled on this system.
member.returns: true if UAC is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Vanara.Security.UAC.IsRunningAsAdmin(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: The function checks whether the primary access token of the process belongs to user account that is a member of the local Administrators group, even if it currently is not elevated.
member.returns: Returns true if the primary access token of the process belongs to user account that is a member of the local Administrators group. Returns false if the token does not.

member.name: T:Vanara.Extensions.ActiveDirectoryExtension
member.summary: Extensions for AD objects (e.g. DomainController).

member.name: M:Vanara.Extensions.ActiveDirectoryExtension.CrackNames(System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController,System.String[],Vanara.PInvoke.NTDSApi.DS_NAME_FORMAT,Vanara.PInvoke.NTDSApi.DS_NAME_FORMAT,Vanara.PInvoke.NTDSApi.DS_NAME_FLAGS)
member.summary: Converts an array of directory service object names from one format to another. Name conversion enables client applications to map between the multiple names used to identify various directory service objects. For example, user objects can be identified by SAM account names (Domain\UserName), user principal name (UserName@Domain.com), or distinguished name.
member.param: Contains one of the DS_NAME_FORMAT values that identifies the format of the output names. The DS_SID_OR_SID_HISTORY_NAME value is not supported.
Contains one of the DS_NAME_FORMAT values that identifies the format of the input names.
Contains one or more of the DS_NAME_FLAGS values used to determine how the name syntax will be cracked.
member.returns: The converted names.

member.name: M:Vanara.Extensions.ActiveDirectoryExtension.GetHandle(System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController)
member.summary: Uses reflection to get the hiddent handle of a .
member.returns: A for the domain controller in .

member.summary: Class to represent a set of claim values(s) and to facilitate applying these to an Authz client context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Samples.DynamicAccessControl.ClaimValueDictionary.#ctor(Microsoft.Samples.DynamicAccessControl.ClaimDefinitionType)
member.summary: Identifies if this instance represents user's claims or device's claims
member.param: ClaimDefinitionType.User to indicate user's claims and ClaimDefinitionType.Device to indicate device's claims.
member.remarks: When ClaimDefinitionType.User, AithzModifyClaims in invoked with SidClass AuthzContextInfoUserClaims and when ClaimDefinitionType.Device with SidClass AuthzContextInfoDeviceClaims.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A object containing the information required to serialize the .
A structure containing the source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Samples.DynamicAccessControl.ClaimValueDictionary.ApplyClaims(Vanara.PInvoke.Authz.SafeAUTHZ_CLIENT_CONTEXT_HANDLE)
member.summary: Adds or replaces claims in the specified Authz Client Context.
member.remarks: This method invokes AuthzModifyClaims, modifying the claims using AUTHZ_SECURITY_ATTRIBUTE_OPERATION_REPLACE. This ensures that the values of a claims that already exists are replaces and the ones not present are added.
member.param: Handle to the Authz Client Context to be modified
member.returns: Win32Error.ERROR_SUCCESS on success and Win32 error code otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Samples.DynamicAccessControl.ClaimValueDictionary.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Implements the interface and returns the data needed to serialize the instance.
member.param: A object that contains the information required to serialize the instance.
A structure that contains the source and destination of the serialized stream associated with the instance.
